text: The length of that interval varies with respect to many parameters, including the bacterial species, type of medium, temperature, and pH. The generation time for cells in culture is also known as the doubling time, because the population of cells doubles into a complex medium will divide every 20 minutes.
In an environment with unlimited resources, bacteria divide at a constant interval called the generation time.
After 1 hour of growth (three generations), that one cell will have become eight (1 to 2, 2 to 4, 4 to 8).
As noted already, generation time is important when we’re trying to understand how rapidly a pathogen can cause disease symptoms.
In biotechnology, how fast a producing organism grows will affect how quickly a commercially useful by-product can be made.
Because cell number occur if cell number rose by a fixed amount after every generation (for example, 1 to 2, 2 to 3, 3 to 4).

a single cell after three generations (n = 3) will produce 1 cell × 23 = 8 cells The number of generations that an exponential culture undergoes in a given time period can be calculated if number of cells at the end of the period (Nt) are known.
Let’s review how we calculate generation time.
Why do we care about generation time?
the length of time from one generation to the next.
